data.title: Just know they only take cash....
data.text:
I stop here regularly for my cherry lemon Sundrops, which are always perfect, and the other day I got a Ranchburger, which is just a small hamburger that comes with a small order of fries, but I got it without the fries. The server who took my order was pleasant and she remembered the extra napkins and the salt I asked for, which shows the employees care about their level of service. I got my order to go and it was as quick as it should have been for something that was made fresh. It was very good, as well. 

I trust the food here and the consistent level of kind service. Just remember that they aren't able to take credit cards, for some reason, and the ATM they have does not work, either. So make sure you have cash if you decide to stop here.

data.title: The BEST hamburger!
data.text:
Based on quality, price, and service. 

My favorite: What-a-Salisbury, fries (extra crispy), and a Witchdoctor. 

Several locations in the area: downtown Concord, Mt. Pleasant, north Kannapolis, and my favorite #10 in Midway. 

Not the healthiest meal, but the most memorable!

data.title: Good Old Time Food
data.text: If you enjoy the occasional delicious "greasy hamburger" then this is your place. No frills at all, just big and tasty food. The cheeseburgers are to die for and highly recommended. Do not forget the fries as they are tasty and crunchy. Food prices are easy on the wallet as well.  A good place to eat for the some  times grease rush that you crave.

data.title: love the fries, but remember your cash
data.text: We love What A Burger! It's a place we enjoy going to, usually after a school function. The food is always cooked to order, and those french fries! Always hot, perfectly salted! I must admit, I've never strayed from the What-a-burger, burger because it's so darned good. BUT.... this place STILL will NOT accept debit cards, so if you do not have cash, you are either out of luck, must run to YOUR bank in town, or are forced to the little MAC machine they have there. Keep in mind they charge the largest FEE possible on this machine PLUS your bank will ALSO charge you.... so it's like an additional meal added on top of what you are ordering. Bummer, yeah, totally. This is why they do NOT get 5 stars from me. Totally inconvenient in this day and age not to be able to use your debit card.

data.title: Good burgers.
data.text: This is a local hamburger joint and the burgers are good.  The only twist in this restaurant is the cleanliness.  They should take a little of the profits from the food and redecorate.

data.title: Traditional buger place
data.text: You get your burger (or other) cooked to order right there. Service is super, and fast. Great place to get one. Try their concoction: Cherry Lemon Sundrop for a beverage!

data.title: Good old fashioned North Carolina style burgers
data.text: I love the old places where they bring the food to your car as they do in Mooresville, NC. Service is always fast, food is fresh. My only complaint is they do not accept credit cards. Just talking about  it has me wanting to drive to Mooresville!!  I stopped by there often after visiting my mother in a nursing home. Just sitting in my car, waiting for some good, fresh food (dogs, burgers, fries) gave me a chance to unwind from the evening. Wish there were more places like this!

data.title: Good when you need it
data.text: Food is reasonable, good or average in quality and normally the help are nice and attentive.  Cleanliness is a bit on the lower end but it is designed to be an order and pickup type place.

data.title: Best Burgers and Milk Shakes
data.text: What-a~burger is an institution. Great burgers and fries and best milk shakes anywhere.  Guess you could call it a greasy spoon but great place to go when you are in a hurry.

data.title: Witch Hazel soda, off the chain, One and only taste in the world.
data.text: The taste of the food is Unique and the place is too. Think about going into a burger food place in the 70's, friendly people, everybody knows each other. They also knows what you always orders, your name and the last time you came. Its like going to your mother, brother, sister and cousin's house. Love What- A- Burger

data.title: Great down home greasy food
data.text: Very tasty. They must be doing something right as they have been around Concord/Kannapolis area  in numerous locations since the 'stone age'.

data.title: Good Old 50's 60's Burger
data.text: This place had been here for years. Every items on the menu is same as it was in the early 40's and 50's. If you want that same oldies taste that will take you back in time then this is the place to go for a good old burgers.

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Found by accident.... stopped for a burger. You must try the what a burger. The fries were hot too. Im coming back for more of their onion rings... good stuff.

data.title: The real deal!
data.text: My best friend grew up in Concord and has been eating at What-A- Burger all her life so when I go down to visit she always takes me there.The burgers are big and tasty,the service always good and the nostalgic atmosphere makes this little place worth a visit!

data.title: Step back in time
data.text: Inside has original 60's interior.  Order at counter and wait to hear your number called to pick up. Burger was fine, large bun with toothpick holding it all together. .  Fries and hush puppies were good.  Other eater had hamburger steak, I will try it next time.  Was kind of skeptical but we were pleasantly surprised. Good basic food for good prices.  Decent place for quick low key dining At what is apparently a local institution.

data.title: Memories of High School Days
data.text: I have been eating What-a-Cheesburger and drinking Cherry-Lemon Sundrop since HS back in the late 60's.  Moved away after marriage and every visit home had to visitn the What-A-Burger.  Now retired and back love to go and sit outside and order and eat there.  Times have not changed it just as good as ever.

data.title: down home burgers that are remind you of your parents backyard fixing's.
data.text: Some of their menu:  Burgers (cheese, chilly, slaw, onion, mustard, lettuce, tomato), hot dogs, chicken fries,BBQ, regular fries, witch doctor drinks (sundrop, cheerwine, a little lemon juice, and pickles), crushed ice in your drinks.  Clean.  Very fast and friendly service.  They are still making it the same way they did back in 60's and 70's. Their burgers and hotdogs are the best around.  And no one else can make a witch doctor like they do. They even have the crushed ice unlike most restaurants.  The price is better than a burger at Mcdonald's-cheaper.  I'd rather drive here which is over an hour way for me than get a burger close to home. They have got everything:  Delicious reasonable priced foods, clean building, friendly/fast service, nostalgia (if you grew up around here), history (wall of pics of what they and concord looked like from 40's and up), etc.  The only down side I wish they had one closer to where I live at.

data.title: Food we grew up on
data.text: Kannapolis, NC is lucky to have the What-A-Burgers restaurants live and well.  There were several locations where we gathered at on weekends and after the football games Friday nights.  Best burgers and fries you could ever want.  The 926 S Main location in Kannapolis is a place many in the 50-60 age group still gather at and talk about times gone by.  The city has lots of history and the restaurant has pictures of Mrs Roosevelt visiting Cannon Mills back in the 40's.  It is worth the travel off I-85 in Concord-Kannapolis exit 62 to have a good burger, fries and Cherry -Lemon Sundrop.  The 60's were some of the best times in life.

data.title: Good little local burger joint
data.text: Good food. Good fast service. Old Resturant. Kind of place where all the regulars are known

data.title: best burger on the planet
data.text: I miss What-a-burger so bad, moved to Fl. I still go there everytime I am in Concord or Kannapolis. Cant get a burger with cheese, chilly, slaw, onion, and mustard here. We have Sundrop in Florida now!!!
